conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on object A and the deformation of springs B and C.
Initially, object A is at rest, and spring B is not deformed.
Object A is connected to spring B and a rope over a pulley to spring C.
Forces on A: gravitational force, tension from rope, force from spring B.
When spring C is pulled to position b, spring B compresses and exerts an upward force on A.
Calculate gravitational force on A: F_g = 19.6 N.
At equilibrium, tension T and force from spring B both equal gravitational force F_g.
Force from spring B: F_B = 19.6 N.
Calculate compression of spring B: Δx = 0.098 m.
Horizontal displacement of spring C's right endpoint is 0.6 m.
Tension in spring C equals tension in rope: T = 19.6 N.
Deformation of spring C equals horizontal displacement: Δx_C = 0.6 m.
Calculate stiffness coefficient k_2 of spring C: k_2 = 32.67 N/m.
Final answer: Height A rises is 0.098 m, stiffness coefficient k_2 is 32.67 N/m.
